content: spring kerchief by knittimo materials yarn a 1 skein of malabrigo yarn lace 470 yds / 50 g - shown in apple green yarn b 1 skein of malabrigo yarn lace 470 yds / 50 g - shown in natural us 3 3 25 mm and us 0 2 mm circular needles 2 stitch markers blocked gauge 24 sts and 42 row = 4 in stockinette st measurements 59 wide 17 deep note this triangular kerchief is worked with yarn held double throughout top yarn a x 2 in stockinette middle yarn a + b in stockinette bottom yarn b x 2 in garter directions divide yarn a into 1/3 and 2/3 with 2 strands 1 from each held together co 2 sts on larger needle knit 7 row pick up and knit 3 sts from garter ridges on left side of piece and 2 sts from co sts 7 sts set-up ws k2 yo p1 pm p1 pm p1 yo k2 9 sts next rs k2 yo k to marker m1r sm k1 sm m1l k to last 2 sts yo k2 4 sts increased next ws k2 yo p to last 2 sts yo k2 2 sts increased repeat last 2 row abbreviations co = cast on when the smaller yarn a is used up join yarn b felted join works fine bobble = bind off now with yarn a and b held together keep working the same until yarn a is st s = stitch es almost used up ending with a completed ws row k = knit p = purl yo = yarn over then with remaining yarn b held double start working in garter st on smaller pm = place marker needle keep increasing the same way sm = slip marker rs same as above 4 sts increased m1r = make 1 right ws k2 yo k to last 2 sts yo k2 2 sts increased m1l = make 1 left if you like to keep the center spine in stockinette st purl the center st on ws rs = right side work until just enough yarn for bobble is left ending with a completed ws row ws = wrong side bobble knitwise on rs with larger needle weave in ends wet block enjoy © 2013 sachiko uemura all rights reserved for personal and non-commercial use only
